definition: big/huge/large/major/great/wide/deep/older (than)/oldest/eldest/greatly/very much/(dialect) father/father's elder or younger brother

sentences.english: Kid's extremely conceited arrogance is for covering up oneself's heart of flabbiness .
sentences.chinese: 孩子狂妄自大是为了掩盖自己内心的软弱。

sentences.english: Too often, we honor swagger and bluster and the wielders of force.
sentences.chinese: 我们往往予以认同崇尚暴力和狂妄自大的人。

sentences.english: Their weak spot is a huge self-respect which can turn sometimes into megalomania.
sentences.chinese: 弱点是膨大的自尊心，容易陷入狂妄自大中。

sentences.english: It was perhaps the most conceited song that any animal ever composed.
sentences.chinese: 这恐怕是一只动物所创作的最最狂妄自大的歌了。

sentences.english: Some may say he was cocky, but it was a trait that fit him well.
sentences.chinese: 有人说他“狂妄自大“，但那曾经是他的标志性特质。

sentences.english: The results of this investment are sometimes hubristic , but often impressive.
sentences.chinese: 这种做法虽然有些狂妄自大，却也令人钦佩。

definition: the eye can see nothing worthwhile all around (idiom); arrogant/condescending/supercilious
to consider everyone else beneath one (idiom); so arrogant that no-one else matters/condescending/to go about with one's nose in the air
to think of oneself as terrific (idiom); arrogant
to believe oneself infallible (idiom)/to be opinionated
to think too much of oneself/self-important/arrogant
to think highly of oneself (idiom); giving oneself airs/arrogant and self-important
to speak conceited nonsense/to come out with arrogant claptrap
not to know the immensity of heaven and earth/an exaggerated opinion of one's own abilities
pinyin: bu4 zhi1 tian1 gao1 di4 hou4
